objective.summary: Ensure that users who choose Simple Mode (credit_mode = FALSE) experience credit card tracking identically to debit card tracking, with no credit-specific features (installments, statement periods, credit budgets). This story validates backward compatibility for existing users post-migration and confirms Simple Mode behaves as intended.
objective.user-story: As a user who chose Simple Mode for my credit card (or an existing user with pre-migration credit cards), I want my credit card transactions to work exactly like debit card transactions with no credit-specific features, so that I can track expenses simply without being interrupted by installment prompts, statement periods, or credit budgets.
objective.core-principle: Simple Mode Guarantee: When credit_mode = FALSE, the user experience is functionally identical to using a debit card. No installment prompts, no statement tracking, calendar month budgets only.

case.title: Simple Mode with Historical Credit Mode Data
case.scenario: User previously used Credit Mode, has paid_off installment_plans, then switches to Simple Mode
case.expected-behavior: Historical installment_plans remain in database (not deleted). UI shows NO installment data for Simple Mode user. Current transactions behave as Simple Mode (no credit features).

case.scenario: Credit card has credit_mode = FALSE but statement_closing_day = 15 and payment_due_day = 10 (set from previous Credit Mode or manual edit)
case.expected-behavior: Statement dates completely ignored by all features. Budget calculation uses calendar month. No statement-related UI shown.

case.title: NULL Mode Post-Migration
case.scenario: Existing user with credit_mode = NULL views dashboard after migration
case.expected-behavior: No errors or crashes. Card appears in payment method list normally. No mode selection prompt until user adds new transaction.

case.title: Multiple Cards - One Simple, One Credit
case.scenario: User has Card A (Credit Mode) and Card B (Simple Mode). Adds transaction with Card A, then Card B.
case.expected-behavior: Card A transaction shows installment prompt. Card B transaction shows no installment prompt. Each card respects its mode independently.

dev-notes.note: This story is primarily VALIDATION work, not new feature development. Focus on comprehensive testing and ensuring Simple Mode truly behaves like debit tracking.
Backward compatibility is CRITICAL. Existing users must see zero changes until they add a new transaction. Migration must not auto-populate credit_mode.
When in doubt about Simple Mode behavior, ask: "Would this appear for a debit card?" If the answer is NO, it should not appear for Simple Mode.
Mixed mode scenarios (multiple cards, different modes) must be thoroughly tested. Each card operates independently according to its mode setting.
Historical installment data should remain in database when switching to Simple Mode, but be completely hidden in UI. Do not delete historical data.
